Package org.daiitech.naftah.utils.reflect.type

Class JavaType

java.lang.Object
org.daiitech.naftah.utils.reflect.type.JavaType
public final class JavaType extends Object
Represents a Java type along with its generic type parameters and array component type.

This class wraps a Type and provides utilities to inspect:

  • The raw Class of the type
  • Parameterized type arguments (if any)
  • Array component type (for array or generic array types)
  • Type category checks such as collection, map, tuple, pair, triple, or array

It is commonly used for type introspection in reflective, generic-aware, or serialization/deserialization contexts.

Author:
Chakib Daii

  • Field Details

    • type

      private final Type type
      The original Java Type represented by this JavaType. This could be a Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType, TypeVariable, or WildcardType.

    • rawClass

      private final Class<?> rawClass
      The raw Class corresponding to the type. For generic types, this is the non-parameterized class (e.g., List.class for List<String>). For arrays, this is the array class (e.g., String[].class).

    • typeParameters

      private final List<JavaType> typeParameters
      The list of type parameters for this type. For example, for Map<String, Integer> this would contain JavaType representations of String.class and Integer.class. Empty for non-generic types or arrays.

    • arrayComponentType

      private final JavaType arrayComponentType
      The component type if this JavaType represents an array. For example, for String[][], this would represent String[]. For non-array types, this is null.

    • ofObject

      public static JavaType ofObject()
      Returns a JavaType representing Object.
      Returns:
      a JavaType for Object

    • resolveRawClass

      private static Class<?> resolveRawClass(Type type)
      Resolves the raw Class from a given Type.

      This method handles:

      • Class returned directly
      • ParameterizedType returns the raw type
      • GenericArrayType returns the array class of the component type
      • WildcardType resolves the upper bound
      • TypeVariable returns Object as a default

      Parameters:
      type - the Java type to resolve
      Returns:
      the raw Class corresponding to the type
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the type is unrecognized

    • resolveTypeParameters

      private static List<JavaType> resolveTypeParameters(Type t)
      Resolves the type parameters for a given Type.

      If the type is a ParameterizedType, this method recursively wraps each actual type argument in a JavaType and returns a list of them. Otherwise, returns an empty list.

      Parameters:
      t - the type to resolve
      Returns:
      a list of JavaType representing type parameters; empty if none

    • isAssignableFrom

      public static boolean isAssignableFrom(Object obj, JavaType targetType)
      Determines whether a runtime object is assignable to a target JavaType.

      This method combines runtime type inspection with strict generic validation. Unlike simple type inference, container types are validated exhaustively (element-by-element or entry-by-entry) to ensure runtime type safety.

      Key behaviors:

      • Dynamic numbers: If the target type represents a Number (excluding DynamicNumber) and the object is a DynamicNumber, numeric compatibility is delegated to DynamicNumber.isAssignableFrom(Class).
      • NaftahObject unwrapping: If the object is a NaftahObject and the target type is not, the underlying Java value is extracted and validated instead. When the underlying value represents a map-like structure, both the map shape and its contained values are validated recursively.
      • NTuple validation: For Pair and Triple targets, component types are inferred at runtime and validated against each tuple element.
      • Collection validation: If the target type is a collection, every non-null element is validated against the collections generic parameter. Validation fails immediately upon encountering an incompatible element.
      • Map validation: If the target type is a map, every entry is validated by checking both key and value types against the target maps generic parameters. For Naftah-backed maps, declared value types are validated recursively.
      • Fallback: For non-container types, validation is performed against the objects runtime class only.

      Leniency:

      • Simple object and primitive-compatible types are checked leniently (raw-type compatibility only).
      • Tuples, collections, and maps enforce strict generic validation.

      Notes:

      • null elements within containers are considered assignable and are ignored during validation.
      • This method guarantees correctness for the current contents of container objects but does not prevent future mutations from violating type constraints.
      Parameters:
      obj - the runtime object to validate; must not be null
      targetType - the target JavaType; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if the object is assignable to the target type, including all applicable generic constraints; false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if obj or targetType is null
      See Also:
      • JavaType
      • DynamicNumber
      • NaftahObject
      • NTuple
      • Pair
      • Triple

    • of

      public static JavaType of(Triple<?,?,?> triple)
      Creates a JavaType representing a parameterized Triple.

      The resulting type preserves the runtime class of the triple and infers generic type arguments from the runtime types of its elements:

      • The left, middle, and right element types are inferred from their non-null runtime classes
      • If an element is null, Object is used as its type
      Parameters:
      triple - the triple whose runtime type should be analyzed
      Returns:
      a JavaType describing the parameterized triple type

    • of

      public static JavaType of(Pair<?,?> pair)
      Creates a JavaType representing a parameterized Pair.

      The resulting type preserves the runtime class of the pair and infers generic type arguments from the runtime types of its elements. If either element is null, Object is used as a fallback type.

      Parameters:
      pair - the pair whose runtime type should be analyzed
      Returns:
      a JavaType describing the parameterized pair type

    • of

      public static JavaType of(Collection<?> collection)
      Creates a JavaType representing a parameterized Collection.

      The collections raw runtime class is preserved. The element type is inferred from any non-null element in the collection. If the collection is empty or contains only null values, Object is used as the element type.

      Parameters:
      collection - the collection whose runtime type should be analyzed
      Returns:
      a JavaType describing the parameterized collection type

    • of

      public static JavaType of(Map<?,?> map)
      Creates a JavaType representing a parameterized Map.

      The maps raw runtime class is preserved. Key and value types are inferred independently from any non-null keys and values present in the map. If the map is empty or contains only null keys or values, Object is used as a fallback type.

      Parameters:
      map - the map whose runtime type should be analyzed
      Returns:
      a JavaType describing the parameterized map type

    • getJavaType

      public static JavaType getJavaType(Object obj)
      Infers the most appropriate JavaType for a runtime object.

      This method analyzes the runtime structure of obj and produces a JavaType that reflects both its concrete class and, where applicable, inferred generic type parameters.

      Type inference rules

      • NaftahObject instances are unwrapped before analysis
      • Pair and Triple values produce parameterized tuple types
      • Collections produce parameterized collection types
      • Maps produce parameterized map types
      • Non-Java-origin NaftahObject values may be treated as Map&lt;String, DeclaredVariable&gt;
      • All other values fall back to their concrete runtime class

      When generic element types cannot be determined (for example, due to null values or empty containers), Object is used as a fallback.

      Parameters:
      obj - the object whose type should be inferred
      Returns:
      a JavaType describing the inferred runtime type
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if obj is null

    • resolveArrayComponent

      private JavaType resolveArrayComponent(Type t)
      Resolves the array component type for a given Type.

      If the type is a GenericArrayType, the component type is wrapped in a JavaType. If the type is a standard array, returns the component type as a JavaType. Throws an exception if the type is not an array.

      Parameters:
      t - the type to resolve
      Returns:
      the component type as a JavaType
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the type is not an array

    • getTypeParameters

      public List<JavaType> getTypeParameters()
      Returns the list of type parameters of this type.

      For example, for Map<String, Integer> it will return [String.class, Integer.class] wrapped as JavaType.

      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of type parameters; empty if none

    • getArrayComponentType

      public JavaType getArrayComponentType()
      Returns the component type if this type is an array or generic array.
      Returns:
      the array component type, or null if not an array

    • isOfType

      public boolean isOfType(Class<?> raw)
      Checks if this JavaType is of the specified raw class or a subclass thereof.

      This method is similar to Class.isAssignableFrom(Class), and returns true if the provided raw class is a superclass or the same class as this type's raw class.

      Parameters:
      raw - the class to check against
      Returns:
      true if raw is assignable from this type's raw class, false otherwise

    • hasRawClass

      public boolean hasRawClass(Class<?> raw)
      Checks whether this JavaType has exactly the specified raw class.

      This method performs a strict comparison against the raw (erased) type represented by this JavaType. It does not consider inheritance, assignability, or generic type parameters.

      Use this method when you need to verify that a type is exactly a specific raw class, such as Object.class, Tuple.class, or Pair.class, rather than a subtype.

      For assignability checks (similar to instanceof), use isOfType(Class) or isAssignableFrom(JavaType, boolean) instead.

      Parameters:
      raw - the raw Class to compare against; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if this JavaType has exactly the given raw class, false otherwise

    • isCollection

      public boolean isCollection()
      Returns true if this type is a Collection.
      Returns:
      true if collection type

      public boolean isList()

      Returns:
      true if set type

    • isTuple

      public boolean isTuple()
      Returns true if this type is a Tuple.
      Returns:
      true if tuple type

    • isNTuple

      public boolean isNTuple()
      Checks whether this JavaType represents an N-tuple type.

      An N-tuple in Naftah is defined as one of the following tuple variants:

      • Tuple a general tuple type
      • Pair a 2-element tuple
      • Triple a 3-element tuple

      This method checks only the raw type of the tuple and does not consider generic type parameters.

      Returns:
      true if this type is a tuple, pair, or triple; false otherwise

    • isArray

      public boolean isArray()
      Returns true if this type is an array.
      Returns:
      true if array

    • isMap

      public boolean isMap()
      Returns true if this type is a Map.
      Returns:
      true if map type

    • isPair

      public boolean isPair()
      Returns true if this type is a Pair.
      Returns:
      true if pair type

    • isTriple

      public boolean isTriple()
      Returns true if this type is a Triple.
      Returns:
      true if triple type

    • isAssignableFrom

      public boolean isAssignableFrom(JavaType other, boolean lenient)
      Determines whether this JavaType can accept (is assignable from) another JavaType.

      This method generalizes Class.isAssignableFrom(Class) to operate on fully parameterized types, including generic type parameters and dynamically inferred types.

      Assignability rules:

      • Object is treated as the top type and is assignable from any type.
      • The raw class of this type must be assignable from the raw class of the other type.
      • If this type declares no generic parameters, raw-type compatibility alone is sufficient.
      • If generic parameters are present, their count must match exactly.
      • Each generic parameter must itself be assignable, recursively.

      When lenient is true, only raw-type compatibility is checked. When lenient is false, generic parameters are strictly validated.

      This method supports special handling for numeric types, including DynamicNumber, allowing runtime numeric compatibility checks.

      Parameters:
      other - the JavaType to test against; must not be null
      lenient - whether generic parameters should be ignored
      Returns:
      true if this type can accept the other type; false otherwise

    • isAssignableFrom

      public boolean isAssignableFrom(NTuple nestedObjects, JavaType other, boolean lenient)
      Internal assignability check that optionally uses runtime values (encapsulated in an NTuple) to validate generic parameters.

      This overload is used when validating container types (such as tuples, collections, or maps) where runtime values are available and generic parameters must be checked against actual elements.

      If nestedObjects is provided and its arity matches the number of generic parameters, each generic parameter is validated against the corresponding runtime value.

      Parameters:
      nestedObjects - runtime values corresponding to generic parameters, or null if no runtime validation is available
      other - the runtime-derived JavaType
      lenient - whether to ignore generic parameters
      Returns:
      true if assignable under the specified rules

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this type, including type parameters if present.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the type name with parameters

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Compares this JavaType to another for equality.

      Two JavaType objects are equal if their underlying Types are equal.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - the object to compare
      Returns:
      true if equal
